title: The Bank holiday crisis of 1933
creator_credit: William Russell, James Fonda and Young America Films
brief_description: In March, 1933, President Roosevelt declared a bank holiday to help the American nation recover from the panic of financial collapse. The situation is shown in scenes in a bank, in soup kitchens and milk lines and in a Salvation Army home in New York. Narrated by Walter Cronkite.
creator_credit_for_label: William Russell, James Fonda and Young America Films
